video.title: TEDTalks: Chew On This
video.synopsis: Take a seat at the TED table with master bakers, food scientists, chefs, farmers and foodies for a taste of truth about food.

episodes.synopsis: Sharing stories from his anti-obesity project, TED Prize winner Jamie Oliver calls for an assault on the ignorance of food.
episodes.title: Jamie Oliver's TED Prize Wish: Teach Every Child About Food

episodes.synopsis: With impeccable research and deadpan humor, chef Dan Barber chronicles his pursuit of a sustainable fish he could love.
episodes.title: Dan Barber: How I Fell in Love with a Fish

episodes.synopsis: In this fiery and funny talk, New York Times food writer Mark Bittman weighs in on what's wrong with the way we eat now.
episodes.title: Mark Bittman on What's Wrong with What We Eat

episodes.synopsis: In a carnivorous culture, it's hard to be vegetarian. Graham Hill's powerful, pragmatic suggestion: Be a weekday vegetarian.
episodes.title: Graham Hill: Why I'm a Weekday Vegetarian

episodes.synopsis: Louise Fresco shows us why we should celebrate mass-produced, supermarket-style white bread.
episodes.title: Louise Fresco on Feeding the Whole World

episodes.synopsis: Chef Dan Barber tells the story of a small farm in Spain that has found a humane way to produce foie gras.
episodes.title: Dan Barber's Foie Gras Parable

episodes.synopsis: Reporter Jennifer 8. Lee talks about her hunt for the origins of familiar Chinese-American dishes.
episodes.title: Jennifer 8. Lee Hunts for General Tso

episodes.synopsis: Every day, in a city the size of London, 30 million meals are served. An architect discusses the miracle of feeding a city.
episodes.title: Carolyn Steel: How Food Shapes Our Cities

episodes.synopsis: The "Renegade Lunch Lady" talks about the coming revolution in the way kids eat at school.
episodes.title: Ann Cooper Talks School Lunches

episodes.synopsis: A cookbook author and geek talks about modernist cuisine and the secret behind photos of cross-sections of food being cooked.
episodes.title: Nathan Myhrvold: Cooking as Never Seen Before

episodes.synopsis: We have more than 100 million neurons in our intestines. Explore the surprising things the "hidden brain" in our gut makes us feel.
episodes.title: Heribert Watzke: The Brain in Your Gut

episodes.synopsis: A baking master reflects on the cordial couplings (wheat and yeast, starch and heat) that give us our daily bread.
episodes.title: Peter Reinhart on Bread

episodes.synopsis: The head of the UN's World Food Program tells us why, in a world with enough food for everyone, people still go hungry.
episodes.title: Josette Sheeran: Ending Hunger Now

episodes.synopsis: Chef Arthur Potts Dawson shares his personal vision for drastically reducing restaurant and supermarket waste.
episodes.title: Arthur Potts Dawson: A Vision for Sustainable Restaurants
